intro: Strophacanthus celebicus, commonly known as the Celebes strophacanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Sulawesi in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in lowland forests. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, with a distinct aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
